lines.text: An hour ago we were in my laboratory on our Earth, and now...
You are still on your own world, Dr. von Steiner - Earth. The year is 2071, and our world is dying.

[Approaching the girl he is obviously attracted to]
Hi.
Be well.
Yeah, you too.

[Attracted to him]
You're a good-looking boy.

[laughing nervously at Reena's agressiveness]
You're pretty cute yourself. I-I, uh, I, uh...
Will you come with me later?
Well, I... sure, you bet!
I know all the single men in the colony, but no one interests me.
Well, that's fine.

[Propositioning him]
You do. Will you come to my cubicle?
Don't you like me?
Of course, I like you. You're a beautiful girl.
Oh, that! Beauty is only skin deep.
Well, it's deep enough. What do you want - a lovely liver?
We must consider the greater good. I must do what I think is right.
And what about us?
Nobody invited you here.
At least give us a chance to try to find a solution.
It's impossible!
Until you have tried and failed, nothing is impossible!

We have been constantly surveying every possible planetary body in our solar system. Every planet. Every one of their moons. Even some of the smaller asteroids, but... This is the last; Titan, one of Saturn's largest atmosphere-carrying moons.
Robot surveyors?
Yes.
You don't seem encouraged.
The analysis shows a complete negative response. I'd expected it.
But you still maintain surveillance. Why?

Information, Dr. Von Steiner. Knowledge. We feel we can never have enough of that in the new world we are going to occupy. There it is - our entire solar system. And nowhere can Man exist. Nowhere! Including Earth.
